definition: to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: He was sure, he said diplomatically, that the government would do all it could.
sentences.chinese: 梁先生曾婉转表示，他确信政府已经尽力。

sentences.english: Take advantage of exit interviews, and diplomatically explain your stance.
sentences.chinese: 好好利用告别的面谈，婉转的解释你的立场。

sentences.english: I will tactfully admonish him not to behave like this again .
sentences.chinese: 我会婉转的规诫他不要这样做。

sentences.english: The builder refused genially, as he did everything else.
sentences.chinese: 营造者的拒绝是很婉转的，这人无往而不婉转。

sentences.english: The builder refused genially, as he did everything else.
sentences.chinese: 营造者的拒绝是很婉转的，这人无往而不婉转。

sentences.english: Also want to euphemize voice lessons.
sentences.chinese: 也要用婉转的语态教训。

sentences.english: Lark used dulcet singing offered wonderful performance for animals. The lion king was very happy.
sentences.chinese: 百灵鸟用婉转的歌声给动物们献上了精彩的演出。

sentences.english: You can duck, shimmering tactfully, that I will not stop for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 任你梨涡浅笑，波光婉转，我也不会再停歇片刻。

sentences.english: THAILAND’S recent political history has been, to put it mildly, volatile.
sentences.chinese: 泰国近年的政治，说得婉转些，是风云变幻。

sentences.english: In the garden outside, the birds were singing and the bees buzzing.
sentences.chinese: 外面的花园里，鸟儿婉转啼叫，蜜蜂嗡嗡作响。

sentences.english: With envy of my sweet pipings.
East road "Er-ren-tai" melodies persuasive smooth, the melody is changeable.
sentences.chinese: 东路二人台的唱腔则婉转流畅，旋律变化多端。

sentences.english: She made a suggestion in a very roundabout way.
sentences.chinese: 她很婉转地提出了一个建议。

sentences.english: The singer on the cassette began to warble another song.
sentences.chinese: 盒式磁带里的歌手开始婉转地唱出另一首歌曲。

sentences.english: I have not felt to warble and trill, however sweetly.
sentences.chinese: 我没有感觉到颤抖，婉转，或者是甜蜜。

definition: sinuous/meandering/to take a circuitous route/to toss about/vicissitudes/variant of 婉轉|婉转[wan3 zhuan3]
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
see 一倡三歎|一倡三叹[yi1 chang4 san1 tan4]
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
